lead_paragraph: John MacKenzie, who murdered Officer Matthew Giglio in 1975, repented and became a model inmate, but was repeatedly denied parole. It was too much for him to bear.

headline.print_headline: Merciless End for a Cop Killer
headline.main: Merciless End for a Long Island Cop Killer

snippet: John MacKenzie, who murdered Officer Matthew Giglio in 1975, repented and became a model inmate, but was repeatedly denied parole. It was too much for him to bear....
abstract: John MacKenzie, sentenced to 25 years to life for killing Long Island Police Officer Matthew Giglio in 1975, committed suicide in upstate New York prison after 10th plea for parole was rejected despite his exemplary prison record; MacKenzie had filed lawsuit claiming parole board was wrong to focus solely on fact that he had killed police officer without considering his rehabilitation and likelihood of living law-abiding life upon release; suicide has prompted debate throughout New York State's criminal justice system.
